Especially friends who like craft beers and rare spirits and who aren't shy about spending a pretty penny to enjoy themselves.

Reviews.Author: Steph T.
Reviews.Content: Went for quiet lunch with friend and briefly: yummy scallops, few vegetarian options- only 1 vegetarian option for my friend! Dessert was lovely. Great ambience.

Reviews.Author: Thomas S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and exceptional service. Friendly and professional staff. Was on the louder side, so ask for a quieter table if you prefer.

Reviews.Author: Deaddog D.
Reviews.Content: Been coming here since it opened - maybe 15 times overall.  Used to be great - quality ingredients cooked with care.  Unfortunately, it has been getting progressively worse, with last night's food truly terrible.  Soggy, cold fish and chips, tasteless seafood boil, extremely fishy bass, and a weird overall odor of hot dogs throughout the restaurant (yes, I know they don't serve hot dogs - hence the "weird.")  Service was very rushed and impersonal, yet professional - clearly geared toward tourist crowd.  After some hesitation, they replaced the fish and chips with a hot batch, and, to their credit, comped it but, notably, didn't say anything about the comp until after we ordered expensive (and high margin) teas and desserts -- I wonder if the comp would have happened otherwise.   I suspect the huge tourist crowds supporting the overly high entree prices has made them complacent.  Too bad - used to be a favorite but I'll avoid from now on.

Reviews.Author: Peter B.
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable burger place with good food but not a place to go if you intend to talk - it isn't possible unless you do sign language. It is a real turn off

Reviews.Author: Natalie P.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Sat night with my parents and my boyfriend and had a great dinner. Its an upscale gastropub with inventive food. My dad had a smoked haddock cake to start with and it was one of the best things I have ever tasted. I really didn't find it touristy at all (maybe b/c its downtown across from mil. park that someone thought that) ... I had read about it in Food and Wine and it was a great suggestion. Good wine list too. Also the bar seemed to be a good place to sit and have a drink. I liked how the manager came around to make sure how everyone's meal was. And the fois gras was tasty too.

Reviews.Author: Thomas G.
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic meal at The Gage last night. We ordered a little bit of everything and were not disappointed. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: Preppy, power-lunch and after-work location. I feel under-dressed in business casual. It gets loud after work. Food is expensive. But the food is very good and sometimes that's the atmosphere you want. It's on Michigan Ave across from the Art Institute.

Reviews.Author: jim m.
Reviews.Content: Tried this place on a lark after a nearby event - had done some research and kind of knew what it would be like. The space, though nothing special decor-wise, is huge, goes on and on - we were pleased to be seated immediately at 8:30 on a Friday night.  Drinks are pricy but healthy, the wine pour was generous (probably two glasses elsewhere), good martini. Food portions are large. We had mussels vindaloo (plump and not at all chewy), goat ragout, and fries. That was plenty and we are not shy eaters. Service was helpful and effective, waiter's suggestions were right on. We appreciated that they try to do much more than would be necessary to keep this place busy given the location, like an actual chef-driven menu and food philosophy. And warm bread. Be warned, though, this is not the place for an intimate one-on-one or romantic experience - the tables are very close together and you will hear every word of your neighbor's conversation whether you want to or not.

Reviews.Author: Philip C.
Reviews.Content: Look, the food here is good. Go here for lunch if you are touring Chicago's better menus.  Don't waste your dinner here... there are better dinner spots.

Reviews.Author: john k.
Reviews.Content: Stoppeed by with some friends on a whin after an architecture tour. Fun atmoosphere. I had some beer and the duck fried nuts which were amazing.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca A.
Reviews.Content: We sat at the bar. The menu wasn't appealing so I had the default of steak with (garlic) mash potatoes.  Both were very good. I also like their dirty martinis with the blue cheese olives. yum.

Reviews.Author: Rebekah D.
Reviews.Content: It was good but way too crowded!  Great bartenders,

Reviews.Author: Emily W.
Reviews.Content: do NOT come here if you are a vegetarian.   There are 2 vegetarian options.  One is a brick of mashed potatoes that tastes like ham ($20).  The other was a gigantic portion of mushy onions and cheese ($20).  The waiter recommended we get the "borsch" soup.  This was a large bowl of pink salt water with 3 almonds floating in it ($12!!!!).  This was possibly the most disgusting meal I have ever shared with someone.

Reviews.Author: mariah t.
Reviews.Content: The foos and service are great!  Prices are a bit too high to go there too often but when we do we always have a great meal.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth R.
Reviews.Content: Enormous pub across from Millennium Park. Some of the options can get a bit spendy, so order a pint of Guinness and the newspaper-wrapped fish and chips - delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: I love The Gage! I had the cauliflower soup, mushroom sandwich, and pistachio cake. Everything was absolutely delicious and the service was great! They also make homemade sodas. This place is a real find and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Author: Scott B.
Reviews.Content: While not really a gluten-free location, I did enjoy my meal here. The food was delicious and ample, and the service was friendly and quick. The atmosphere is upscale bar, with lots of glass and wood. it is a loud location as there are very few soft surfaces to absorb the sound, but it is still a great place to go for lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Author: Pickle P.
Reviews.Content: As to be expected in this area, The Gage is expensive.  But, my best friends live a block away, so of course we'll try it out.  We went during restaurant week, intending to delve into one of the specially priced restaurant week options, but all 4 of us ended up opting otherwise, off the regular menu.  Interesting beer to choose from, although my bloody mary did not hit par (this is one area in which I am extremely picky - though I do not think it should be that hard to please a bloody mary lover!)  I had the brisket sandwich - very delicious.  We all enjoyed our entrees; it was just pretty expensive, so we probably will not be back.  There are other restaurants in the River North and non-loop areas that do not cater to the tourist population and thus are more reasonably priced and still have quality food.  That's where I will stick.

Reviews.Author: Jim P.
Reviews.Content: Great place for lunch across from the Bean.

Reviews.Author: Sade B.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food! Prices are a little on the high side for just a lunch, but the quality and variety are worth it. Fish and Chips, Salmon sandwich, Brisket, and you can't go wrong with anything during brunch.

Reviews.Author: Emily M.
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty standard place for a business lunch. I like it even better for happy hour. Good beers on tap.

Reviews.Author: Amory D.
Reviews.Content: I had the fish and chips, my wife had the lobster.  The food was excellent.  Very different menu from a typical gastropub.  We will go there again.

Reviews.Author: Fuad T.
Reviews.Content: Very noisy!  Bagpipe indoors, seriously?!  The food wasn't good, and the hostess was quite rude.

Reviews.Author: Michael R.
Reviews.Content: Great spot. The roast duck was excellent as were the scallops. Twice in about 5 minutes, the food delivery guy came by my table with a meal I didn't order. It was a fast floor so I assumed he just messed up the table number or something. However, for that my glass of wine was on the house. Unrequested (and unnecessary really) but a nice touch on their part. And the cappuccino I had to close the meal was really terrific. One thing though; don't be put off by the lack of a dress code. This is the sort of place where tuxedos dine along side sleeveless t-shirts.

Reviews.Author: Twan S.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came here for lunch, and the people were wonderful and the environment was nice. We ordered poutine and half way done we find a finger nail, no lies. We tell them and the guy just said "Oh, let me take that for you". So we're like alright whatever he might not charge us. We get our main course (Burger and a Chicken Sandwich) and my friend finds hair with the fries. My friend had no more appetite and didn't even touch his burger yet. He tells the waiter and guess what he said? "Are you done with that sir?" My friend was explaining to him and that waiter just took it and walked away. We asked for our bill and they charged us everything, they didn't give us new food, didn't apologize, and this was the service we got from a restaurant like this. You would think you they would do at least something to make up for it, but they just acted like nothing happened and basically asked for their money.  It's kind of dumb, because we were just two sailors just wanting try good food and got the worst service and still had to pay them the ridiculous price. Talk about quality...

Reviews.Author: Maria A.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there at 4pm on a Saturday, just the time when they were swapping their lunch menu for the dinner one. We were very happy with whatever we've ordered - soup of the day, mixed greens, scotch egg, duck fat nuts and Hanger steak. Our waiter was also pretty 'cool', on top of being super attentive without being annoying .... We'll surely be going there again ....

Reviews.Author: Sonya S.
Reviews.Content: Went to the Gage after Jazz at the Pritzker perfect location right across the street.  We had a reservation and sat outside facing the beautiful park.  The owner came over to make suggestions and was very nice as was all of the staff.  All of our meals were delicious, the service and ambiance great.  I lovely evening.

Reviews.Author: Kat K.
Reviews.Content: We live in the neighborhood, and have been to Gage a handful of times.  We won't be going back, because so-so meals outnumber good ones.  The lunch is fine- they have good burgers and their salads are okay.  I've gotten the ham and brie sandwich a couple of times, but the last time, the brie was all rind- literally big srips of white rind.  I sent it back, and the manager comped the inedible sandwich.  Once I ordered soup, and it was stone cold.  We went in for dinner once, and my risotto was crunchy and overcooked, and very rich.  You're safer ordering pub food at Gage.

Reviews.Author: Paula C.
Reviews.Content: Two of the three times I've visted The Gage, the owner has come over to check on our experience -- gotta love that.  The food is very good and the service is always excellent.  Fun location across from Millennium Park -- great place to take out-of-towners.

Reviews.Author: Patricia B.
Reviews.Content: Heard a lot about The Gage and was eager to go there.  On a weekday night after work, it was very crowded and exremely noisy.  The service was good despite the crowd.  Overall, somewhat overpriced.  Wines by the glass were surely good but also more expensive than most higher-end places.  In this economy, it might be better to go to a place that doesn't charge such high prices.  But, judging from the packed place, people will pay those prices.  Maybe I will go back, but I am not in any hurry to do so.

Reviews.Author: Kathy G.
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to try this place after reading the reviews but I was more than a little disappointed. The evening started strong, attentive waiter, great sense of humor and right on wine recommendation. It only went downhill after our meals were served. I ordered the tuna lightly seared, which it was but the fish was warm on the inside, almost like it had been sitting under a heat lamp. I sat with an empty wine glass for 10 minutes, my friend was also left with out anything to drink and it took a concerted effort to get the waiters attention to rectify the situation. Not sure I would go again for the price.

Reviews.Author: Heather H.
Reviews.Content: Cool, contemporary.... Great Food & Great Atmosphere right off Millenium Park

Reviews.Author: jujubeez D.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, great drinks and awesome service with an owner who is very involved and visible and has an awesome Irish accent to boot. They're batting 1,000 here. Curry gravy fries are a must have as well as the brie dip. I just wish I'd had time to go back a third time for lunch on my way out of town on Wednesday.

Reviews.Author: Nick F.
Reviews.Content: Eh, it's ok. A little crowded, a little noisy, and the food is only ok. Nothing i'd go out of my way for. Just overall kinda mediocre. /shrug

Reviews.Author: Katherine L.
Reviews.Content: I really like the Gage, it's probably one of my favourite semi-casual restaurants in the Loop. It's quite smart, but in a sort of laid back way. I've always had an excellent meal here. I especially like the Vindaloo mussels, which is an interesting twist on one of my favourite foods. Don't come here expecting any classic favourites that will taste the way you expect, everything is different, but in a good way. The only complaints I would have is that it does get quite noisy and the portions are absolutely massive, although I suppose some don't really consider that a complaint.

Reviews.Author: Amy C.
Reviews.Content: The food was very good, the service was great and the drinks were tasty too.  The onion and potato soup was to die for!  My only complaint was the bread, it overpowered the delicate flavors of the meal.  But I know that is a really picky comment.  The manager was nice enough to even discuss my comments about the bread and told us they're using a new bakery.  I'm very happy with my meal and customer service.I"d recommend it to anyone wanting a hip place for a meal in the Loop

Reviews.Author: Alyssa B.
Reviews.Content: The poutine with the elk ragout was delicious!!!

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to The Gage during a business trip last October on the recommendation of the concierge at The Renaissance and we loved everything, repeat everything about this eatery.  The service was attentive and very personable, the menu was both diverse and eclectic, the wine list was excellent, and the atmosphere was what I hoped for and expected at a downtown Chicago gastropub on a Friday night.  My wife had a seasonal risotto and I had a regional sausage & peppers dish which were both fabulous.  If you are visiting Chicago and want a true 'taste' of current Chicago restaurant fare, treat yourself to The Gage.

Reviews.Author: Lori W.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE The Gage! It was the first restaurant that my boss took me to eat when I moved to the Loop a year ago. I love the food, the service, the energy and the dedication to locally grown and raised food. Everything is fresh and the service is friendly but professional. I don't eat dairy and the sorbet is homemade and amazing.

Reviews.Author: Claudia F.
Reviews.Content: As busy as the were during 2 lunches during our a recent stay, the wait staff was so attentive.  The venison burger was so good my companion had it twice.  I had the beet salad which I thoroughly enjoyed and the pear soup - excellent.  On the second visit, I enjoyed the turkey sandwich, which was very good.  I wish we could have been there at dinner but we did stop in for a drink at night and again, friendly and prompt staff.  Drink prices were what we expected and what we pay in NYC.

Reviews.Author: krystal p.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I ordered badly, but my crispy rabbit salad was disappointing. A few shreds of rabbit under a pile of Arugula was pretty much the dish. My husband said his fish and chips was fine, but nothing to write home about. Maybe just not out kind of restaurant. Points for good service.

Reviews.Author: K G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent!  Definitely will visit again.  The atmosphere is lively and energetic.  We sat inside, but in a very comfortable booth.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our server provided recommendations, and they were outstanding!  I enjoyed one of their custom gin cocktails and the dining special.  My husband enjoyed the fish and chips (but, trust me, it is no ordinary fish and chips ... highly recommended!).  A foodie paradise in the heart of all the activity in the Loop.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer B.
Reviews.Content: Great place to drop by after the Art Institute, but don't eat here if you are looking for something light & healthy. It's definitely indulgence worthy, though. The fries are among The best I've ever eaten. Lively ambience.

Reviews.Author: liza o.
Reviews.Content: Love this place.  Though a little pricey for portions that are sometimes on the smaller side, I've been there a lot.  It's tried and true, and a good place to bank on.

Reviews.Author: graham h.
Reviews.Content: a perfect fusion of drinking and eating. every time i go, and its alot, the service never fails to impress, and the food never disappoints. the beer list has most of my favorites, and the cocktails are great. but i keep going back mostly for the duck confit, the goat cheese soup, and the amazing ribeye sandwich at lunch. even the burgers are fantastic, and nice and cheap.

Reviews.Author: J H.
Reviews.Content: Pricey and pretentious are the two words that spring to mind with this place. It is very much a see and be seen kind of place for the "in" crowd after work, and I think is probably best for a drink and a snack. Why would you ruin beautiful west coast oysters by putting a very fishy tasting roe and lemon gelee on top? It wasn't bad, but the flavor combinations try to hard to be fancy and, for the price, there are restaurants that execute better (in every dish we had, there was some ingredient that just killed the whole thing). For two people including drinks, the bill came to around $200 (that was for 2 people with 1 starter, 1 main and 1 glass of wine each plus a round at the bar with 6 oysters). The one nice surprise, for $12, the glasses of wine were very generous (in a small carafe), so everyone can get what they like and not be penalized by not getting a bottle. Service level was also pretty good, and the wait time was quoted accurately.

Reviews.Author: Miss O.
Reviews.Content: my new obsession: caramelized lobster w/lemon basil quinoa.

Reviews.Author: erika s.
Reviews.Content: this place is great. one star deduction for a. douche bag factor 2.the fact that the dining room always seems to have an hour and half wait even if it's lunch and there are 2 people visibly occupying space. that being said, they usually have available seating outside or in the bar area. this is hands down one of the best lunch spots available in the loop--try the 1/2 soup 1/2 sandwich. it comes with delicious french fries and is way more valuable than it's $13 ticket price (aka huge). the service here (both bar and table) has never disappointed and their beer list/cocktails are pretty vast. their house cured salmon app is better than the sandwich for some reason. i'd skip the venison tartar--lacking in flavor. pretty much anything else is a win. the chef here definitely means business and has my favorite name around--my guess is dirk flanigan is a ladies man, but that's purely speculative. swears.

Reviews.Author: J. O.
Reviews.Content: This place starts out promising but ends with an eh.  The appetizers and soups are really unique and delicious, but the entrees are just ok.  The scotch egg (deep fried, hard boiled egg with this awesome dijon mustard) is something I had never tried, probably would not have tried if someone else hadn't ordered it to share, but will always order in the future because it is so surprisingly good.  I went to a cocktail party here with some passed horsd'oeuvres, and those were excellent.  They went above and beyond typical passed horsd'oeuvres, serving deconstructed chicken wings and fish and chips in newspaper.  But the entrees I have ordered sounded great on paper, and then were just ok.  Last time I had the steak salad, which the most bitter greens and no dressing to counteract its bitterness.  The beef was kobe but lacked any flavor to justify the fat.  I would come back here for after work drinks and appetizers, but skip dinner for later.

Reviews.Author: Ccc C.
Reviews.Content: the food is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Thomas R.
Reviews.Content: The food and plating were really just fair for the prices. The best things we ate were the soup special and the fish & chips. The Poached Shrimp and Caramelized Lobster both came in deep bowls without a spoon, making it virtually impossible to eat the quinoa underneath the lobster with a big dinner fork, and completely impossible to enjoy the herb broth under the shrimp. I had to request a spoon for the first course and would have for the second course had our server returned. I had to send back the Wagyu Sirloin which was way overcooked for a medium-rare order. I was annoyed that the chef tried to pass it off as though it being Wagyu beef should be enough to keep a diner happy. This was my second visit and the first was similarly uneven. The noise level was awful at times. There's a whole tribe of people who scream across the table when they're in close proximity to a bar. I don't know whether it's the alcohol or the sight of a bar that brings out the screaming in them, but depending on where you are seated in this restaurant you may have to endure extreme noise over what attempts to be fine dining. Choose your table carefully - if you want a quieter experience go for the back of the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Xinyuan W.
Reviews.Content: love the atmosphere and service here. really cozy seating and dim lights, very romantic, cocktails were great. their burger is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Samantha R.
Reviews.Content: After a couple of internet searches for the best fish and chips, my mom and I found this place, which is about 5 blocks from my apartment. We made a reservation online about 30 minutes ahead, but didn't need it. They weren't that busy since it was the Tuesday after Memorial Day. Server was very friendly and helpful with the menu. We had a scotch egg to start, which was amazing. They make the sausage in house. The fish and chips were good, but not the best ever. In all fairness, I have a really high standard for fish and chips. I had the sea scallops, and those were the best ever! Hands down. No contest. I would go back just to eat those again. The coffee is also worth mentioning. The have their own blend roasted by La Colombe. The server wrote down the place so we could go check it out on our own. I thought the prices were a bit high for the type of food, but that is what you get on Michigan Ave across from the Art Institute. Overall, worth checking out, but no need to place on a "must" list.

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: excellent food, great service.
